Name: Australia
Description: The largest country in Oceania, known for its unique wildlife, stunning beaches, and the iconic Great Barrier Reef.

Name: Papua New Guinea
Description: A country located in Oceania, known for its diverse cultures, languages, and natural landscapes including rainforests and mountains.

Name: New Zealand
Description: A country comprising two main islands, known for its picturesque landscapes, Maori culture, and famous films like 'The Lord of the Rings.'

Name: Fiji
Description: An island nation in the South Pacific, known for its beautiful beaches, coral reefs, and vibrant indigenous culture.

Name: Solomon Islands
Description: An island nation in the Pacific Ocean, known for its history during World War II and its rich marine biodiversity.

Name: Vanuatu
Description: An island nation in the Pacific Ocean, known for its volcanic islands, unique cultures, and pristine beaches.

Name: Samoa
Description: An island nation in the South Pacific, known for its tropical climate, beautiful beaches, and strong Polynesian culture.

Name: Tonga
Description: An island kingdom in the South Pacific, known for its Polynesian culture and beautiful coral reefs.

Name: Kiribati
Description: A nation consisting of 33 islands in the Pacific, known for its low-lying atolls and being one of the most affected by climate change.

Name: Marshall Islands
Description: A country consisting of a chain of islands in the Pacific Ocean, known for its historical significance during World War II and nuclear testing.

Name: Palau
Description: A small island nation in the Pacific, known for its pristine coral reefs and clear blue waters.

Name: Nauru
Description: The third smallest country in the world, located in the Pacific, known for its phosphate mining and unique landscape.
